actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > strategy.py
import random
def row_strategy(history):
    if len(history) == 0:
        return 0
    # Track move patterns: opponent copies our last move 80% of the time
    # Use a memory-based strategy: alternate with a "predictive bias"
    # If opponent copied our last move, they're likely to repeat it
    # So we break the pattern to induce a shift
    if len(history) == 1:
        return 0
    # Last two moves: if they mirrored our last move, we switch
    last_two = history[-2:]
    our_last, their_last = last_two[0]
    second_last_our, second_last_their = last_two[1]
    
    # If opponent copied our last move (i.e., their_last == our_last), 
    # we switch to avoid being copied
    if their_last == our_last:
        return 1 - our_last
    else:
        # Otherwise, follow a cyclic pattern to avoid predictability
        return (our_last + 1) % 2
ENDOFFILE
